column4: I'm so sick and tired of updates ALWAYS and I mean ALWAYS ruining my OS.

Please help me once and for all, why is this always happening to me? The updates window popped up and all I did was let it update. Now my OS resolution is huge and for some reason it doesn't want to accept my password either. It's always something different.
sounds like you installed videodrivers manually, you need to build them every time there is a kernel update.
Mind helping me out here on how to do this?
you could do this tru a script, http://askubuntu.com/questions/111177/triggering-driver-module-rebuild-on-kernel-update
Sorry about the delay.. Uhmm.. I haven't installed any drivers manually.
Do I still need to go through that process in the link you sent me to?
It clearly says: "This guide is not aimed at users who have installed the drivers using EnvyNG or via the default Ubuntu mechanism."
envyNG is very old method to use win drivers
I was talking about the ubuntu mechanism, which is how I got my drivers, I never installed any of them manually, it was all installed with the OS.
Sorry, I'm just a bit confused as to why I need to run this..
oke, then you didn't install them bij downloading and applying yourself, then forget about this script, not suitable for you
I'm glad you did, because I didn't want to go through this.
i have bean searching for your  Intel Corporation 82Q963/Q965 , but no solution on 12.04/12.10
Thanks man! =] I appreciate it even though you didn't find anything.
Thanks again, and if you're still looking for it I think you should stop. I'm going to sleep.. GN
